quest.name: Way of the Leatherworker
journal: Randall wishes you to reaffirm your desire to join the Leatherworkers' Guild.
You must receive Guildmaster Geva's permission if you wish to join the Leatherworkers' Guild. Seek her out in the workshop and impress upon her your desire to learn.

Though you have been accepted into the Leatherworkers' Guild, you have much to prove if you are to meet their high standard of craftsmanship. To embark upon your journey as a leatherworker, equip the knife Geva gave you and speak to her again.

dialogue.name: RANDALL
dialogue.text: Have you decided to join the Leatherworkers' Guild?

dialogue.name: RANDALL
dialogue.text: Regrettable...though I am pleased to see the gravity of the decision is not lost on you.

dialogue.name: RANDALL
dialogue.text: Few are resolute enough to work with leather, knowing full well the source.

dialogue.name: RANDALL
dialogue.text: Very well. I invite you to speak with Guildmaster Geva.

dialogue.name: RANDALL
dialogue.text: She is a brilliant artisan, personally responsible for the creation of countless Fen–Yll products. You have doubtless heard her name before.

dialogue.name: RANDALL
dialogue.text: The guildmaster's patterns are uniformly elegant, and with them even novice craftsmen can cut their materials with minimal waste.

dialogue.name: RANDALL
dialogue.text: It is for her to decide if you are fit to join us.

dialogue.name: RANDALL
dialogue.text: She can be found in the work area within. Present yourself to her and do not waver in your determination.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: So you wish to become a leatherworker?

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: If you've spoken with Randall, then you've been told what it means to work with leather─the weight you must carry, the responsibility you must bear.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Not just to the elementals, mind you, but also to the guild. Our craftsmanship is unrivaled, and each member is expected to live up to that reputation.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Once you join, there is no turning back. If you dishonor us, I shall flay you myself and make a chocobo saddle from your hide.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Will you swear to uphold our traditions and be the best leatherworker you can be?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Swear to uphold the traditions of the Leatherworkers' Guild?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: A shame. You might have made a halfway decent leatherworker─or a serviceable saddle at worst.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Very well, you may learn our craft within these walls...

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: ...though you seem ill equipped to do even that.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: I will give you a head knife to help you on your way, but the rest is up to you.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Do not presume that your association with us means your work will bear the Fen–Yll name. Until you prove yourself worthy, you will not be permitted to so much as touch a Fen–Yll product, much less craft one.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Now then, if we're to continue with your initiation, you'll need to put that knife in your hand first. Talk to me when you're ready to begin.

obj.n: So You Want to Be a Leatherworker
